message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.SY 

The paper presents a novel algorithm for zeroth-order optimization that is numerically stable and has convergence guarantees. This is a topic that is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), optimization (cs.NE), data structures (cs.DS), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and control systems (cs.SY). Given the focus on optimization and convergence analysis, cs.LG and cs.NE are the most likely categories, followed by cs.DS and cs.AI. The connection to control systems (cs.SY) is less clear, but the paper does mention the use of the algorithm in robotics, which could be relevant to this sub-field.
